intro: Sunaptea javanica, commonly known as the Javanese sunaptea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
